Interface ec.time.SkippableRunnable

public interface interface SkippableRunnable
This is akin to a Runnable, but it's allowed to be skipped when used for Timer.setAbsoluteRepeatCallback.

See Also:
Timer

run(long)
This is implemented by a class to perform whatever appropriate action is desired.

run 
 public abstract void run(long ticks)
This is implemented by a class to perform whatever appropriate action is desired. It is passed the number of ticks since the last time it was run, which, if the appropriate Timer is keeping up, is normally 1. If more than Long.MAX_VALUE ticks have passed, then it is run repeatedly with Long.MAX_VALUE until there's a smaller remainder.

Parameters:
ticks - the number of ticks since the last run
